headline: Loews Q4: Earnings Take A Hit On Pension Charge, But Pipelines And Buybacks Offer Silver Lining
summary: Loews Corp (NYSE:L) reported a fourth-quarter revenue of $4.55 billion compared to $4.26 billion a year ago. EPS was $0.86, down from $1.99 a year ago. Net income fell to $187 million from $446 million a year ago. This year’s fourth quarter results include a pension settlement charge for CNA Financial Corporation‘s (NYSE:CNA) of $265 million, after-tax and noncontrolling interests, which was previously reported in October 2024. headline: Loews fourth-quarter profit falls on insurance unit woes
summary: Extreme weather events such as hurricanes, wildfires, and other natural disasters swept the United States last year, eroding underwriting margins for insurers.  Net income attributable to Loews from the insurance unit dipped to $19 million for the three months ended Dec. 31, compared with $336 million last year.  The losses were partially offset by a rise in the New York-based parent company's investment income to $696 million in the quarter, from $643 million a year earlier.

headline: Loews Just Dropped a $187M Bombshell--But Its $3.3B War Chest Has Investors Watching
summary: Earnings plunged 58%, but with $3.3B in cash and a $611M buyback spree, Loews is making big moves.

headline: Loews: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: NEW YORK (AP) — Loews Corp. L) on Monday reported net income of $187 million in its fourth quarter. The New York-based company said it had profit of 86 cents per share.
